channel.title: attack.discovery on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.discovery on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Suspicious AdFind Execution
item.description: Detects the execution of a AdFind for Active Directory enumeration

item.title: Windows Pcap Drivers
item.description: Detects Windows Pcap driver installation based on a list of associated .sys files.

item.title: Advanced IP Scanner
item.description: Detects the use of Advanced IP Scanner. Seems to be a popular tool for ransomware groups.

item.title: Enumeration via the Global Catalog
item.description: Detects enumeration of the global catalog (that can be performed using BloodHound or others AD reconnaissance tools). Adjust Treshhold according to domain width.

item.title: Harvesting of Wifi Credentials Using netsh.exe
item.description: Detect the harvesting of wifi credentials using netsh.exe

item.title: Trickbot Malware Recon Activity
item.description: Trickbot enumerates domain/network topology and executes certain commands automatically every few minutes. This detectors attempts to identify that activity based off a command rarely observed in an enterprise network.

item.title: Operation Wocao Activity
item.description: Detects activity mentioned in Operation Wocao report

item.title: Bloodhound and Sharphound Hack Tool
item.description: Detects command line parameters used by Bloodhound and Sharphound hack tools

item.title: Cisco Collect Data
item.description: Collect pertinent data from the configuration files

item.title: Cisco Discovery
item.description: Find information about network devices that is not stored in config files

item.title: Cisco Sniffing
item.description: Show when a monitor or a span/rspan is setup or modified

item.title: SAM Registry Hive Handle Request
item.description: Detects handles requested to SAM registry hive

item.title: Network Sniffing
item.description: Network sniffing refers to using the network interface on a system to monitor or capture information sent over a wired or wireless connection. An adversary may place a network interface into promiscuous mode to passively access data in transit over the network, or use span ports to capture a larger amount of data.

item.title: Windows Network Enumeration
item.description: Identifies attempts to enumerate hosts in a network using the built-in Windows net.exe tool.

item.title: System Owner or User Discovery
item.description: Adversaries may use the information from System Owner/User Discovery during automated discovery to shape follow-on behaviors, including whether or not the adversary fully infects the target and/or attempts specific actions.

item.title: Query Registry
item.description: Adversaries may interact with the Windows Registry to gather information about the system, configuration, and installed software.

item.title: Capture a Network Trace with netsh.exe
item.description: Detects capture a network trace via netsh.exe trace functionality

item.title: SCM Database Handle Failure
item.description: Detects non-system users failing to get a handle of the SCM database.

item.title: SysKey Registry Keys Access
item.description: Detects handle requests and access operations to specific registry keys to calculate the SysKey

item.title: Hacktool Ruler
item.description: This events that are generated when using the hacktool Ruler by Sensepost

item.title: Baby Shark Activity
item.description: Detects activity that could be related to Baby Shark malware

item.title: Dridex Process Pattern
item.description: Detects typical Dridex process patterns

item.title: Net.exe Execution
item.description: Detects execution of Net.exe, whether suspicious or benign.

item.title: Reconnaissance Activity with Net Command
item.description: Detects a set of commands often used in recon stages by different attack groups

item.title: Suspicious Reconnaissance Activity
item.description: Detects suspicious command line activity on Windows systems

item.title: WannaCry Ransomware
item.description: Detects WannaCry ransomware activity

item.title: Whoami Execution
item.description: Detects the execution of whoami, which is often used by attackers after exloitation / privilege escalation but rarely used by administrators

item.title: AD Privileged Users or Groups Reconnaissance
item.description: Detect priv users or groups recon based on 4661 eventid and known privileged users or groups SIDs

item.title: Domain User Enumeration Network Recon 01
item.description: Domain user and group enumeration via network reconnaissance. Seen in APT 29 and other common tactics and actors. Detects a set of RPC (remote procedure calls) used to enumerate a domain controller. The rule was created based off the datasets and hackathon from https://github.com/OTRF/detection-hackathon-apt29

item.title: Network Scans
item.description: Detects many failed connection attempts to different ports or hosts

item.title: Remote Registry Management Using Reg Utility
item.description: Remote registry management using REG utility from non-admin workstation

item.title: Run Whoami as SYSTEM
item.description: Detects a whoami.exe executed by LOCAL SYSTEM. This may be a sign of a successful local privilege escalation.

item.title: Source Code Enumeration Detection by Keyword
item.description: Detects source code enumeration that use GET requests by keyword searches in URL strings

item.title: Turla Group Lateral Movement
item.description: Detects automated lateral movement by Turla group
